intro: Anredera scandens, commonly known as the silver vine, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a trailing or climbing herbaceous plant that produces small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is characterized by its waxy, silver-hued leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often used in ornamental gardening. Anredera scandens is also known for its ability to produce a sticky resin, which can attract certain insects.
